title: GANs
content:
# GANs
[paper](https://papers.nips.cc/paper/5423-generative-adversarial-nets.pdf)


!!! danger Mode Collapse
Mode collapse refers to the issue where the generator disregards inputs, and outputs the same output over and over again, optimizing a single image to fool the discriminator. This is a more stable state, and the generator can see great success if it finds a single kind of image that fools the discriminator every time.
CycleGAN fixes this issue with cycle-consistency loss; the network has to map the output back to the input, so the learned mapping must be one-to-one.
!!!
